text: Kuala Berang is a state constituency in Terengganu, Malaysia. It is currently represented in the Terengganu State Legislative Assembly. ==History== 2004–2016: The constituency contains the polling districts of Getang, Pasir Tinggi, Sungai Ular, Tanggul, Bandar Kuala Berang, Bukit Tok Bat, Telaga, Tanjung Putat, Langgar, Kampung Buluh, Tapu. 2016–present: The constituency contains the polling districts of Getang, Pasir Tinggi, Sungai Ular, Tanggul, Bandar Kuala Berang, Bukit Tok Bat, Telaga, Tanjung Putat, Langgar, Kampung Buluh, Tapu, Sungai Petai, Tajin. ===Representation history=== ==Demographics== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Total electors by polling district in 2016 !Polling district !Electors |- |Getang | align="right" |1,010 |- |Pasir Tinggi | align="right" |1,013 |- |Sungai Ular | align="right" |1,229 |- |Tanggul | align="right" |1,032 |- |Bandar Kuala Berang | align="right" |1,733 |- |Bukit Tok Bat | align="right" |1,455 |- |Telaga | align="right" |2,428 |- |Tanjung Putat | align="right" |767 |- |Langgar | align="right" |1,811 |- |Kampung Buluh | align="right" |1,735 |- |Tapu | align="right" |700 |- |Sungai Petai | align="right" |681 |- |Tajin | align="right" |735 |- | style="background: #f2f2f2" |Total | style="background: #f2f2f2" align="right" |16,329 |- | colspan="2" align="right" |Source: Malaysian Election Commission |} ==Election results== ==References== Category:Terengganu state constituencies
title: Kuala Berang (state constituency)
